pageContext.claim: “To confront this national security crisis, last month I declared a national emergency. …  I'm very concerned with having murderers and drug traffickers and drugs and drug cartels pouring into our country. … We're being invaded by drugs, by people, by criminals, and we have to stop it.”
pageContext.analysis: Southwest border apprehensions have been declining for 20 years and hit their lowest point in four decades during Trump's first year in office, yet Trump calls this a "national security crisis." The primary issue at the border in terms of immigration is the waves of Central American families -- many of them women and children -- who are fleeing their home countries and seeking refuge in the United States. A range of studies shows that legal and undocumented immigrants commit crime at lower rates than the native-born U.S. population.
